title: DevOps Course - Project
description: This work was part of an academic project in DevOps Course.

I have successfully built a Microservices Application, with a Frontend, 2 Backend Services, Wrote the Unit Tests, Built the CI/CD Pipelines, and deployed it all to Kubernetes. I have also prepared a Documentation for the project using Confluence, and Managed the Project using Jira.
Aside from the project, I have also prepared a presentation about Distributed Tracing with Jaeger as part of the course.

title: UTOPIA - Securinets Friendly CTF
description: This CTF was organized by Securinets INSAT on 30 September 2023.
I have contributed with 20 challenges in Various categories. Web Exploitation, Reverse Engineering, Cryptography... In a Friendly manner for new upcomers to the CTF Scene.
My challenges were written in Typescript, Python and Go.

title: Google Cloud Certified Professional Cloud Architect
description: I have successfully passed the Google Cloud Certified Professional Cloud Architect exam.
I have learned a lot about Google Cloud Platform, and I am now able to design, develop, and manage dynamic solutions that are robust, scalable, and highly available.

title: Kli8nt - Streamlined Applications Deployment for Kubernetes
description: This work was part of an academic project in The Final Year Project 2023.

We have built our own Platform as a Service (PaaS), called Kli8nt, where you can authenticate with Github, select a repository, fill some details (Tech stack, build command, env variables..) and you'll get your application automatically deployed on Kubernetes, with TLS support and Logs Observation.

title: NCSC 2k23 - National Cyber Security Congress
description: This Event was organized by Securinets INSAT on 19-21 Mars 2023.
I have contributed with 2 challenges in the Web Exploitation category in the Main CTF. A Frontend Task and a Deno Jail.
I have also contributed with 5 challenges in the Hackback Series, Including Deno Reverse Engineering, RCE, LFI, Basic Blockchain Enumeration, OSINT, and Steganography.
My challenges were written in Typescript.

title: Securinets CTFs
description: This Website acts as a placeholder for CTF events organized by Securinets.
It is built using React, Typescript and Tailwind.

title: The Love Bug CTF - Web Exploitation
description: This CTF was organized by Securinets INSAT on 14th February 2023.
I have contributed with 3 challenges in the Web Exploitation category. A Frontend Task, a Web RCE and a Blind SQL Injection in Go Challenge.
My challenges were written in Typescript, Python and Go.

title: ENIT CTF - Web Exploitation
description: This CTF was organized by ENIT on 4th February 2023.
I have contributed with 8 challenges in the Web Exploitation category.
The Tasks inlcude various types like RCE, LFI, SQLi, Blackbox, Deno Jail..
My challenges were written in Typescript, Python and Go.
note: This CTF is my first ever experience as an Author.

title: DIGINVO
description: Diginvo is a platform that allows you to create & manage invoices
The Platform is build on Private Hyperledger Fabric Network.
The Frontend is built using React, Typescript and Tailwind.
Won Second Place in the I-Techrity Hackathon from IWatch

title: Investee
description: This work was part of an academic project in Scrum methodology.
Investee is a platform that allows you as an event holder, athlete, etc to look for sponsors
I have contributed to the Frontend of the platform using React, Typescript and Tailwind.

title: Gosher
description: This work was part of an academic project in Distributed Systems.
A file sharing protocol, built with Golang and gRPC.

title: KANG, the Multiverse
description: This Project was part of the Tunisian Metaverse Summit Hackathon.

The Kang Protocol is promised to be the Metaverse Project that brings all metaverses to each other, by providing a Developer friendly API to create and manage Users Identities, Assets... with the possibility of interacting with other metaverses built with the same Protocol, therefore building the Multiverse or Interoperability.

title: Eduverse
description: This Project was part of the The Upside Education Hackathon.
Eduverse is an Educational Metaverse that aims to provide a platform for students to learn and interact with each other in a virtual environment.

title: Spendenbox
description: This Project was part of the The FSB Hackathon.
Spendenbox is a platform that allows you to create and manage donation and campaign boxes.
The Platform is built using React, Typescript, NestJS, Solidity and Stripe.
Won First Place in the FSB Hackathon

title: Kane, TICAD8
description: This Project was part of the The TICAD8 Hackathon.
Kane is a Carbon Emission Footprint Monitoring Platform that allows you to monitor your carbon footprint in real time
The Platform is built using React, Typescript, Go.
Won First Place in the TICAD8 Hackathon, Carbon Emission Challenge

title: Talan, Summer Internship 2022
description: As part of the summer internship at Innovation Factory at Talan Tunisia, I have worked on building a Blockchain Infrastructure for a Sport Metaverse.
The Platform is built using React, Typescript, Solidity, Polygon.
I have worked on Decentralized Identity, DAOs, and built a frontend for the DAO.
Was recognized as the best interns team, voted by the Talan Jury.

title: Implementing DevOps with Kubernetes and Microservices
description: This work was part of an academic project in The Final Year Project 2022.
We have successfully built our own Memes App, fully in microservices, wrote the CI Pipelines and deployed it all to Microsoft Azure on Kubernetes.
note: First DevOps Project, I kinda Like Kubernetes now.

title: The Programming Battle Royale 2022
description: Built, Deployed & monitored A Competitive Programming Platform that were used to host a Real world Contest
The Platform is based on Rounds and Qualification and Speed. The first 90% to solve the Problem gets qualied to the next round and so on till there's only 3 teams left
note: First Big Project that I have worked on

title: Billini Menu Challenge
description: Developed A Website For 'Bellini Sousse' In The Context Of Catering
Was part of Bellini Challenge, Feb 2022 in Sousse
note: Just when I started to get to know Business

title: Street Car Hub, Summer Internship 2021
description: As part of the summer internship at Street Car Hub, I have worked on building a Calendar View To Handle Appointments using ReactJS, Redux
note: Learned a lot from my Supervisor

title: Trask
description: Collaborated On Building 'Trask' Project That Helps Garbage Men Do Their Work And Limit Pollution
Built with Redis, Express, React, Leaflet.

title: Sollectify
description: Sollectify is a creator-centric NFT marketplace where users on the platform can easily create, trade and sell non-fungible tokens (NFTs) for their unique digital items like artworks, game items and more.
Built on @Solana sunny and @ProjectSerum
